help: for capture properties that don't have any value
for capture properties that don't have a value for
either a get operation or a set operation or neither of
them.
the property has a byte value
the property has a unsigned long value
the property has a byte array value
the property has a string value
the property has a version structure as value (read only)
the property has a data source structure as value
the property has an enum value
the property has an object as value
the property type should not be equal or higher that kLast otherwise
it means the SDK is not in sync with the actual version of Socket
Mobile Companion running on the host
properties that are common to any devices
properties that are local to a device
properties that are used by Device Manager (BLE)

properties.Name: kAbort
help: Set to notify Capture that the client is shutting down gracefully.
Capture will send device removal events followed by a terminate
event. Once you receive the terminate event, it is safe to shut
down Capture.

properties.Name: kVersion
help: Gets the Capture service version.

properties.Name: kInterfaceVersion
help: Gets the version of the firmware interface that Capture service
supports. This can be useful for determining if the Capture service
supports a particular hardware feature.

properties.Name: kConfiguration
help: property to set or get the Capture configuration

properties.Name: kDataConfirmationMode
help: Gets or sets the data confirmation mode. The data confirmation mode
determines who acknowledges whether the data received was good or
bad.

properties.Name: kDataConfirmationAction
help: Gets or sets the data confirmation action. Data confirmation action
determines how good or bad data is acknowledged.

properties.Name: kMonitorMode
help: Gets or sets the log level of various Capture service components
(Only works on debug builds of the service).

properties.Name: kSocketCamStatus
help: property to get or set the SocketCam status
(iOS only)

properties.Name: kDataEditingProfile
help: property to get and set the Data Editing Profile

properties.Name: kDataEditingCurrentProfile
help: property to get or set the Data Editing Current Profile

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerSymbologies
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Symbologies

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerMinLength
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Decoded Data
Minimum Length

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerMaxLength
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Decoded Data
Maximum Length

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerStartsBy
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Decoded Data
starting by a specific string

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerEndsWith
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Decoded Data
ending by a specific string

properties.Name: kDataEditingTriggerContains
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Trigger on Decoded Data
containing a specific string

properties.Name: kDataEditingOperation
help: property to set or get the Data Editing Operation

properties.Name: kDataEditingImportExport
help: property to set (Import) or get (Export) Data Editing profiles

properties.Name: kVersionDevice
help: Gets the firmware version of the device

properties.Name: kDeviceType
help: Gets the model of the device

properties.Name: kDeviceSpecific
help: Sends an arbitrary get or set command to the device

properties.Name: kDataSourceDevice
help: property to get or set the data source status / information

properties.Name: kTriggerDevice
help: Sets the trigger of the device - can start or stop a read and
enable or disable the physical trigger button on the device.

properties.Name: kApplyConfigDevice
help: property to apply a config to a Capture Device (not yet enabled)

properties.Name: kPreambleDevice
help: Gets or sets a preamble for data decoded by the device. When set,
the preamble is added in front of the decoded data.

properties.Name: kPostambleDevice
help: Gets or sets a postamble for data decoded by the device. When set,
the postamble is added to the end of the decoded data.

properties.Name: kCapabilitiesDevice
help: property to get the Capture Device capabilities

properties.Name: kChangeIdDevice
help: Gets the change id of the device. The change id is a checksum of
all the engine settings - e.g. symbology settings, preamble,
postamble, etc - and can be used to determine if the device
configuration has been altered by another application or using a
command barcode.

properties.Name: kDataFormatDevice
help: property to get or set the Decoded Data Format of a Capture Device

properties.Name: kFriendlyNameDevice
help: Gets or sets the friendly name of the device. The friendly name is
the name that appears in Bluetooth settings.

properties.Name: kSecurityModeDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device Security Mode

properties.Name: kPinCodeDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device PIN code

properties.Name: kDeletePairingBondingDevice
help: Set deletes pairing and bonding information off the device. Useful
when preparing to pair the Capture device to a different host.

properties.Name: kRestoreFactoryDefaultsDevice
help: Set resets all the settings on the device to their default values.

properties.Name: kSetPowerOffDevice
help: Set turns the device off

properties.Name: kButtonsStatusDevice
help: Gets the current state of each button on the device. Consider using
kNotificationsDevice to subscribe to button events instead.

properties.Name: kSoundConfigDevice
help: Gets or sets the sound configuration of the device. There are
separate sound configurations for when a good scan is acknowledged
locally (by the Capture device) and when it is acknowledged by the
host. The same applies to the bad scan sound configuration.

properties.Name: kTimersDevice
help: Gets or sets the trigger lock and auto-off timers. The trigger lock
determines how long the trigger remains locked after decoding data
without receiving confirmation. There are two auto-off timers, one
for when the device is connected to a host and one for when it is
not.

properties.Name: kLocalAcknowledgmentDevice
help: Gets or sets local device acknowledgement. When enabled, the device
acknowledges decoded data as soon as it is decoded. When disabled,
the device waits for the host to acknowledge decoded data and the
trigger will be locked until acknowledgement is received or the
trigger lock timeout has elapsed.

properties.Name: kDataConfirmationDevice
help: Sends an acknowledgement to the device. Acknowledgement can either
be positive or negative - a.k.a. good scan or bad scan.

properties.Name: kBatteryLevelDevice
help: Gets the current battery level of the device. Consider using
kNotificationsDevice to subscribe to battery level change events
instead.

properties.Name: kLocalDecodeActionDevice
help: Gets or sets the local decode action of the device. Determines how
decoded data is acknowledged - i.e. with a beep, rumble, flash or
some combination of all three.

properties.Name: kBluetoothAddressDevice
help: Gets the Bluetooth address of the device

properties.Name: kStatisticCountersDevice
help: Gets the statistics counters of the device. Counters record the
absolute number of times a particular event has occurred.

properties.Name: kRumbleConfigDevice
help: Gets or sets the rumble configuration of the device. There are
separate rumble configurations for when a good scan is acknowledged
locally (by the Capture device) and when it is acknowledged by the
host. The same applies to the bad scan rumble configuration.

properties.Name: kProfileConfigDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device Profile Configuration

properties.Name: kDisconnectDevice
help: Instructs the device to drop its connection. Note: After sending
this command, the host will be unable to send any subsequent
commands to this device.

properties.Name: kDataStoreDevice
help: Gets or sets arbitrary bytes to store on the device. The device has
16 storage locations which can hold up to 64 bytes each.

properties.Name: kNotificationsDevice
help: Gets or sets subscriptions to various events from the device.
Events that can be subscribed to include, trigger press/release,
power button press/release, power state and battery level change.

properties.Name: kConnectReasonDevice
help: property to get the Capture Device Connect reason

properties.Name: kPowerStateDevice
help: Gets the current power state of the device. Consider using
kNotificationsDevice to subscribe to power state events instead.

properties.Name: kStartUpRoleSPPDevice
help: Gets or sets the reconnect behavior of the device when it is
powered on in application mode. By default, the device will attempt
to reconnect to the last host, but this feature can be turned off
using this property.

properties.Name: kConnectionBeepConfigDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device Connection Beep
Configuration.

properties.Name: kFlashDevice
help: Gets or sets the status of the flash on the SocketCam device.

properties.Name: kOverlayViewDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device Overlay View (SocketCam
only)

properties.Name: kStandConfigDevice
help: property to get or set the Capture Device Stand Configuration

properties.Name: kStartDiscovery
help: property to start a BLE discovery from a Device Manager

properties.Name: kFavorite
help: property to set or get the BLE favorites for a Device Manager

properties.Name: kUniqueDeviceIdentifier
help: property to get the BLE Unique Device Identifier that can be used to set favorite with

properties.Name: kPcScTagTransmit
help: property to transmit through PC/SC an array of bytes often called APDU

properties.Name: kPcScCouplerControl
help: property to control the PC/SC coupler device by passing an array of bytes often called APDU

Values.Name: DataConfirmationMode
help: Data Confirmation Mode indicates what is
expected to the send the Data ACK back to the scanner

Value.Name: ModeOff
help: use the device configuration (Local Confirmation or App)

Value.Name: ModeDevice
help: the device confirms the decoded data locally

Value.Name: ModeCapture
help: Capture confirms the decoded data as it receives them and there is one app

Value.Name: ModeApp
help: the Application confirms the decoded data as it receives them

Values.Name: DeviceDataAcknowledgment
help: Device Data Acknowledgment mode

Value.Name: Off
help: the device won't locally acknowledge decoded data

Value.Name: On
help: the device will locally acknowledge decoded data

Values.Name: SecurityMode
help: Security Mode

Value.Name: None
help: No security

Value.Name: Authentication
help: communication protected by authentication

Value.Name: AuthenticationEncryption
help: communication protected by authentication and encrytion

Values.Name: Trigger
help: trigger parameter

Value.Name: Start
help: start a read

Value.Name: Stop
help: stop a read

Value.Name: Enable
help: enable the trigger

Value.Name: Disable
help: disable the trigger

Value.Name: ContinuousScan
help: start a read in continuous

Values.Name: DeletePairing
help: Delete the pairing of the device

Value.Name: Current
help: delete the current pairing

Value.Name: All
help: delete all the pairing of the device

Values.Name: SoundActionType
help: sound configuration for the a type of action

Value.Name: GoodRead
help: sound configuration for a good read action

Value.Name: GoodReadLocal
help: sound configuration for a good read local action

Value.Name: BadRead
help: sound configuration for a bad read action

Value.Name: BadReadLocal
help: sound configuration for a bad read local action

Values.Name: SoundFrequency
help: Sound frequency configuration

Value.Name: None
help: no frequency

Value.Name: Low
help: Low pitch frequency

Value.Name: Medium
help: Medium pitch frequency

Value.Name: High
help: High pitch frequency

Values.Name: RumbleActionType
help: Rumble configuration for the a type of action

Value.Name: GoodRead
help: Rumble configuration for a good read action

Value.Name: GoodReadLocal
help: Rumble configuration for a good read local action

Value.Name: BadRead
help: Rumble configuration for a bad read action

Value.Name: BadReadLocal
help: Rumble configuration for a bad read local action

Values.Name: LocalDecodeAction
help: Define the action for a local decode

Value.Name: None
help: no action

Value.Name: Beep
help: Beep when a local decode occurs

Value.Name: Flash
help: Flash the LED when a local decode occurs

Value.Name: Rumble
help: Rumble when a local decode occurs

Values.Name: DataConfirmationLed
help: Define the LED for data confirmation

Value.Name: None
help: no LED

Value.Name: Green
help: make the LED flash in green

Value.Name: Red
help: make the LED flash in red

Values.Name: DataConfirmationBeep
help: Define the sound for data confirmation

Value.Name: None
help: no sound

Value.Name: Good
help: short beep for success

Value.Name: Bad
help: long beep for failure

Values.Name: DataConfirmationRumble
help: Define the rumble for data confirmation

Value.Name: None
help: no sound

Value.Name: Good
help: short rumble for success

Value.Name: Bad
help: long rumble for failure

Values.Name: Flash
help: Define the flash setting

Value.Name: Off
help: turn off the flash

Value.Name: On
help: turn on the flash

Values.Name: SocketCam
help: Define the SocketCam experience (iOS-iPadOs only)

Value.Name: Enable
help: Enable SocketCam

Value.Name: Disable
help: Disable SocketCam

Value.Name: NotSupported
help: SocketCam is not supported, and cannot be enabled

Value.Name: Supported
help: SocketCam is supported and can be enabled

Values.Name: PowerState
help: Define the possible power states

Value.Name: Unknown
help: The power state is unknown

Value.Name: OnBattery
help: The power state is on battery

Value.Name: OnCradle
help: The power state is on cradle

Value.Name: OnAc
help: The power state in on AC

Values.Name: MonitorDbg
help: Define the monitor feature (DEBUG build only)

Value.Name: Level
help: define the level for the debug traces

Value.Name: Channel
help: define the output channel for the debug traces

Value.Name: FileLineLevel
help: define the number of lines in the file

Values.Name: Counter
help: identifiers for the statistic counters

Value.Name: Skip
help: use for convenience only to skip a counter

Value.Name: Unknown
help: unknow counter

Value.Name: Connect
help: number of connections

Value.Name: Disconnect
help: number of disconnections

Value.Name: Unbound
help: number of unbound operation

Value.Name: FactoryReset
help: number of reset to factory default

Value.Name: Reads
help: number of reads (scans)

Value.Name: TriggerButtonUp
help: number of trigger button released

Value.Name: TriggerButtonDown
help: number of trigger button pressed

Value.Name: PowerButtonUp
help: number of power button released

Value.Name: PowerButtonDown
help: number of power button pressed

Value.Name: OnAcTimeInMinutes
help: number of minutes in AC power

Value.Name: OnBatTimeInMinutes
help: number of minutes on battery

Value.Name: RfcommSend
help: number of RFCOMM sent (SSI only)

Value.Name: RfcommReceive
help: number of RFCOMM received (SSI only)

Value.Name: RfcommReceiveDiscarded
help: number of RFCOMM discarded (SSI only)

Value.Name: UartSend
help: number of UART sent (SSI only)

Value.Name: UartReceive
help: number of UART received (SSI only)

Value.Name: UartReceiveDiscarded
help: number of UART discarded (SSI only)

Value.Name: ButtonLeftPress
help: number of left button press (CRS only)

Value.Name: ButtonLeftRelease
help: number of left button release (CRS only)

Value.Name: ButtonRightPress
help: number of right button press (CRS only)

Value.Name: ButtonRightRelease
help: number of right button release (CRS only)

Value.Name: RingUnitDetach
help: number of ring unit detach (CRS only)

Value.Name: RingUnitAttach
help: number of ring unit attach (CRS only)

Value.Name: DecodedBytes
help: number of decoded bytes (7x only ISCI)

Value.Name: AbnormalShutdowns
help: number of abnormal shutdowns (7x only ISCI)

Value.Name: BatteryChargeCycles
help: number of battery charge cycles (7x only ISCI)

Value.Name: BatteryChargeCount
help: number of battery charge count (7x only ISCI)

Value.Name: PowerOn
help: number of power on (only 8Ci)

Value.Name: PowerOff
help: number of power off (only 8Ci)

Value.Name: StandModeChange
help: number of stand mode change (only 7X/Q 7630 and higher)

Values.Name: Disconnect
help: Disconnect parameters to instruct the device what to do after disconnection

Value.Name: StartProfile
help: disconnect and then start the current profile

Value.Name: DisableRadio
help: Disconnect and disable radio (low power)

Value.Name: MakeAvailable
help: Disconnect a device and make it available for a new connection (for Bluetooth Low Energy device)

Values.Name: ProfileSelect
help: Select a profile for the device (None, SPP, HID)

Value.Name: None
help: The device is in acceptor mode, not trying to connect to any host

Value.Name: Spp
help: The device is in App mode

Value.Name: Hid
help: The device is in Basic mode, sometimes referred as Keyboard emulation

Values.Name: ProfileConfig
help: Configure a profile for the device (None, Acceptor, Initiator)

Value.Name: None
help: The device is in either acceptor or initiator mode, meaning not even discoverable

Value.Name: Acceptor
help: The device is discoverable and will accept any connection

Value.Name: Initiator
help: The device initiates a connection to the Bluetooth address specified in the Profile Configuration

Values.Name: Notifications
help: Configuration masks for selecting the notifications the device should send to the host

Value.Name: TriggerButtonPress
help: The device sends a notification when the trigger button is pressed

Value.Name: TriggerButtonRelease
help: The device sends a notification when the trigger button is released

Value.Name: PowerButtonPress
help: The device sends a notification when the power button is pressed

Value.Name: PowerButtonRelease
help: The device sends a notification when the power button is released

Value.Name: PowerState
help: The device sends a notification when the power state changes (battery to AC or vice-versa) (not supported on all device)

Value.Name: BatteryLevelChange
help: The device sends a notification when the battery level changed (not supported on all device)

Values.Name: Timer
help: Identifies the timers used in the device, (trigger lock, disconnected, connected)

Value.Name: AutoLock
help: The trigger button stays ineffective for the specified amount of time
or until the device receives a data confirmation command.

Value.Name: PowerOffDisconnected
help: This timer specifies the amount of time the device stays on while it is not connected to any host.

Value.Name: PowerOffConnected
help: This timer specifies the amount of time the device stays on while it is connected to a host.

Values.Name: DataFormat
help: Identifies the data format the device should send the data to the host

Value.Name: Raw
help: The device sends the data without any protocol overhead

Value.Name: Packet
help: The device sends the data embedded in a protocol packet (default)

Value.Name: IdOnly
help: The device sends only the RFID tag ID, (valid only for D600 NFC devices)

Value.Name: TagTypeAndId
help: The device sends the tag type and RFID tag ID, (valid only for D600 NFC devices)

Value.Name: DataOnly
help: The device sends only the tag data, (valid only for D600 NFC devices)

Value.Name: TagTypeAndData
help: The device sends the tag type and the tag data, (valid only for D600 NFC devices)

Values.Name: TriggerMode
help: defines the operational mode of the device

Value.Name: LocalOnly
help: The device triggers a read only by pressing the trigger button

Value.Name: RemoteAndLocal
help: The device triggers a read by pressing the trigger button or by receiving the trigger command

Value.Name: AutoLock
help: the device waits for the host to unlock the trigger

Value.Name: NormalLock
help: the device locks and unlocks the trigger locally (default)

Value.Name: Presentation
help: The device triggers a read automatically without user intervention

Values.Name: ConnectReason
help: defines the reason as of how the device connects to the host

Value.Name: Unknown
help: The device connects to the host from unknown reason

Value.Name: PowerOn
help: The device connects to the host just after power on

Value.Name: Barcode
help: The device connects to the host by reading the host address from a barcode

Value.Name: UserAction
help: The device connects to the host by user action (usually a press on the trigger button)

Value.Name: HostChange
help: The device connects to the host from a change of the host address in the profile configuration

Value.Name: Retry
help: The device connects to the host after a retry (device coming back to the radio range)

Values.Name: StartUpRoleSpp
help: The start up role SPP defines the start up role when using the SPP profile.

Value.Name: Acceptor
help: The device returns to acceptor mode, not initiating a connection to a host.

Value.Name: LastRole
help: The device uses the last role configuration upon startup.

Values.Name: ConnectBeepConfig
help: The connect beep configuration allows to turn off or on the connection beep when the scanner connects

Value.Name: NoBeep
help: The device won't beep upon connection to a host.

Value.Name: Beep
help: The device beeps when connecting to the host.

Values.Name: StandConfig
help: The stand configuration defines the operational mode of the device when used with a stand.

Value.Name: MobileMode
help: Mobile mode Works like today existing firmware Engine is always in
trigger mode Engine hibernate enabled

Value.Name: StandMode
help: Stand mode Engine always in presentation mode Engine hibernate
disabled Scanner turns on immediately Power timers disabled Connection
retries forever

Value.Name: DetectMode
help: Detect mode On stand engine in presentation mode On stand engine
hibernate disabled On stand charging led state not show On stand
scanner turns on immediately On stand power timers disabled On stand
connection retries forever Off stand engine in level mode Off stand
battery led state reported Off stand engine hibernate enabled Off stand
power off timers running Off stand connection retries halt after max
count

Value.Name: AutoMode
help: Auto mode On stand engine in presentation mode On stand engine hibernate
disabled On stand charging led state not show On stand scanner turns on
immediately On stand power timers disabled On stand connection retries
forever Off stand does nothing, engine remains in presentation mode Off
stand trigger press causes engine to enter level mode Engine in level
mode battery led state reported Engine in level mode hibernate enabled
Engine in level mode power off timers running Engine in level mode
connection retries halt after max count

Values.Name: ButtonPressMask
help: The mask to apply for each button that is pressed

Value.Name: Left
help: The left button is pressed.

Value.Name: Right
help: The right button is pressed.

Value.Name: Middle
help: The middle button is pressed.

Value.Name: Power
help: The power button is pressed.

Value.Name: RingDetach
help: The Ring is detached from the wrist unit.
